page.title: 08Childrens Playground
page.content: At the side of the King George's playing field there is a children's playground. It has been open about a year. The notice at the entrance says that no children over eleven are allowed inside. Dogs, bicycles and vandals are also banned. A high metal fence surrounds the park and the gate is locked at 7 p.m. The area has been grassed but there are wood shavings in places where children might fall and where the ground becomes muddy. There are wooden picnic tables, benches and litter bins. There is a sand pit, a wooden castle with a ramp, a climbing frame, a roundabout and a slide. There are special swings for babies and also some rockers shaped like motor bikes and birds. Children can spend a happy time in this park.
